result.execSummary:
All charges against Brandon L. Kline in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon L. Kline is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L. Kline

defendant.name: Kline, Brandon L.
defendant.address: 1925 Prairie St A, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM Defendant Brandon L. Kline in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Brandon L. Kline.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case and states the appearances.
ADA Pfeil would be moving to dismiss this case.
Defendant has paid the money back into the estate.
State has complied with victim rights.
Atty Jakobson does not object to the motion.

BY THE COURT: 
Motion to Dismiss is GRANTED.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:13 PM Defendant Brandon L. Kline in court.  ADA Andrew Mutchler appeared on behalf of ADA Brian J Pfeil in for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Brandon L. Kline. 

Atty Jakobson interrupts and states that he had motioned the court for Judge Shannon to recuse himself.
Atty Jakobson states his right of preservation on the record.
CC Kessler has a motion to dismiss that she has in front of her.
Parties are now ready to proceed to the preliminary hearing.
3:15 p.m.  Officer K Ahrens is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Mutchler.
3:16 p.m.  Atty Jakobson objects and states his objection on the record.
ADA Mutchler puts statements on the record.
3:19 p.m.  Court will allow testimony and puts additional statements on the record.
3:20 p.m  Witness identifies the defendant.
3:22 p.m.  Atty Jakobson again objects and states his objection on the record.
CC Kessler questions Atty Jakobson. 
Atty Jakobson states that he is objecting to confidential information that was provided to his prior attorney and he states this on the record.
ADA Mutchler makes statements on the record.
CC Kessler will allow the witness to testify. 
3:26 p.m.  Court Reporter reads the last question back to the witness.
3:27 p.m.  ADA Mutchler shows the witness a copy of the criminal complaint.
3:29 p.m.  Atty Jakobson has his same objection.
CC Kessler informs ADA Mutchler to clean up his questions to get a better record.
3:30 p.m.  Atty Jakobson has the same objection.
3:32 p.m. ADA Mutchler continues his direct examination.
Court is looking at the Court Order dated February 9, 2021 that has been mentioned during this hearing.
Atty Jakobson makes further statements on the record with regards to his ongoing objection.
Court reviews further documents and puts information on the record.
Atty Jakobson would ask that the Court strike information provided by the witness and states this information on the record.
ADA Mutchler makes statements.
Atty Jakobson states on the record what he is claiming privilege with regards to Atty Lauterbach.
3:39 p.m.  Court asks Court Reporter to read back the answer of the witness. 
Atty Jakobson again puts on the record what he is objecting too.
ADA Mutcher responds.
Court makes further statements on the record with regards to the issue at hand.
3:44 p.m.  ADA Mutchler continues is direct examination.
Same objection by Atty Jakobson.
3:52 p.m.  Court interrupts and makes statements.
3:56 p.m.  ADA Mutchler would ask that the complaint be admitted into evidence.
Atty Jakobson objects to this and states his reasons on the record.
CC Kessler will not allow the complaint to be admitted as evidence.
3:58 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Jakobson.
4:00 p.m.  Atty Jakobson provides the witness with a document which she identifies - this document is not marked as an exhibit.
4:03 p.m.  ADA Mutchler has no re-direct.
ADA Mutchler has no further witnesses.
Atty Jakobson has no witnesses.
Witness is excused.
4:04 p.m.  ADA Mutchler gives his final argument.
4:05 p.m.  Atty Jakobson gives his final argument.
4:12 p.m.  ADA Mutchler gives a rebuttal argument.
4:13 p.m.  Atty Jakobson responds to the rebuttal.
CC Kessler makes statements prior to determining if there is probable cause.
CC Kessler takes judicial notice of 19PR78.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Atty Jakobson would ask for a later arraignment date.
Court will need to set this for a motion hearing also. 
Atty Jakobson will correspond with ADA Pfeil to set a new date.
ADA Mutchler informs Atty Jakobson that ADA Pfeil will not be available for the remainder of the week.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brandon L. Kline appeared in court, Attorney Oren Jakobson for Brandon L. Kline appeared in court. 

Atty Jakobson makes arguments as to the sufficiency of the complaint.  Asks to dismiss the complaint. 
Court withholds ruling on the motion and notes the motion has been made.  Arguments and motion go to sufficiency of the complaint and acknowledged and not waived.  Matter will be set for a preliminary hearing.  If the court has time, the court will consider the motion or motions and will rule on that at the time of the preliminary hearing. 
Atty Jakobson does not waive time limits and has one more issue. 

Atty Jakobson asks the court to recuse himself on the matter for the reasons stated. 
Atty Cassidy believes this is a Branch 1 case. 
Court makes statements and notes the concern for this court hearing the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 021673,
Payable Number: 59768,
Receipt Number: 22R 002565,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm. (Incorrect Branch)

02:41 PM Defendant Brandon L. Kline in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court questions if the state is relying on felony or misdemeanor for penalty enhancer.
Atty Mutchler reviews the complaint.
Court notes it appears to be a felony. 
Court continues with charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states he just received the complaint on saturday evening and would like time to get an attorney.  
Court questions how long he would need. 
Defendant makes statements.  
Court asks if 4 weeks would be enough. 
Defendant agrees. 

State recommends a $1,000 bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
